# HealthTrack Pro Sprint Planning Meeting Report for Liam Foster

## Brief Overview
This report summarizes the key outcomes of our recent Sprint Planning Meeting for the HealthTrack Pro project, focusing on aspects most relevant to your role as UI/UX Designer.

## Key Meeting Highlights
- Sprint 1 runs from June 24 to July 7, 2024
- Focus: Implement secure user authentication and basic profile management
- Your primary tasks: Create initial design system in Figma, collaborate on navigation design
- New MVP feature added: Basic goal-setting (may require future design work)
- Jira chosen as project management tool

## Sprint 1 Gantt Chart
![Diagram](https://mermaid.)

## Your Action Items and Next Steps
1. Create the initial design system in Figma, focusing on components for authentication and profile management.
2. Collaborate with Emily (Frontend Developer) on designing and implementing navigation between login, registration, and main app pages (2 story points).
3. Attend daily stand-ups at 9:30 AM to ensure design-development alignment.
4. Prepare for UI/UX polish tasks, scheduled for June 30 - July 1 (see Gantt chart).
5. Plan for profile customization design work, scheduled for July 5 (see Gantt chart).
6. Familiarize yourself with Jira for tracking your design tasks and progress.
7. Review the technical stack (React.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS) to ensure design compatibility.
8. Prepare for the Sprint Review and Retrospective on July 8, 2024.

## General Team Information
1. MVP features now include user authentication, profile management, activity tracking, nutrition logging, health metrics dashboard, and basic goal-setting.
2. The team has identified risks including data security, cross-browser compatibility, and design-development alignment. Your involvement in daily check-ins will help mitigate the latter.
3. Definition of Done includes cross-browser testing and adherence to coding standards, which may impact your design decisions.
4. The project emphasizes data security and GDPR compliance, which should be considered in your UI/UX designs.

## Conclusion
Your work on the design system and navigation is crucial for laying the foundation of HealthTrack Pro. Your expertise in user-centric design will be essential in ensuring a smooth user onboarding experience. Stay closely aligned with the development team, particularly Emily, to maintain design integrity throughout the sprint. If you have any questions or need clarification, don't hesitate to reach out to Sarah (Project Manager) or the development team.
